recipe.ingredients: - olive oil: 1/2 cup - Dijon mustard: 3 tablespoons - apple cider vinegar: 1/4 cup - garlic (minced): 1 clove - honey: 1 tablespoon (optional, can omit for lower sugar) - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Combine Ingredients: In a small bowl or a jar with a tight-fitting lid, combine the olive oil, Dijon mustard, apple cider vinegar, minced garlic, honey (if using), salt, and black pepper. 2. Whisk or Shake: Whisk together the ingredients in the bowl or tightly seal the jar and shake vigorously until all ingredients are well combined and the dressing has emulsified. 3. Taste and Adjust: Taste the vinaigrette and adjust seasoning if necessary. If it's too tart, add a little more honey or olive oil. If too bland, a small pinch more of salt or mustard can be added. 4. Store or Serve: Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. Shake well before each use.
